data.title: We Are the Fallen
data.meta_description: Posts about We Are the Fallen written by Rob Liz
data.text:
Iâ€™m going to start out this post with getting this out of the way; this CD sounds just like Evanescence. I told Rob today, if you would have played me this CD, I would have hit the internet immediately looking for Evanescenceâ€™s latest release.

There. I said it. Can we move on now?

I agree completely with Rob that Carly Smithson has no right to complain about the comparison. You take 3 former members of Evanescence, Ben Moodyâ€™s songwriting/style, a woman who sounds dead on like Amy Lee and almost looks like her (though Amy is WAY hotter) and throw it all together and you have Evanescence carbon-copy We Are The Fallen. I get Ben Moody, I really do. I think heâ€™s brilliant. Iâ€™ve said before and Iâ€™ll say til I die â€œAll For Thisâ€ is one of my all time favourite cdâ€™s (in my top 3). Itâ€™s my opinion, not everyone is going to feel this way. I just understand his need to be melancholy inside the visage of a clown, because Iâ€™ve gone most of my life that way. Which is why I love Evanescence so much.

On that note, letâ€™s get back to the task at hand; hereâ€™s a play by play of the cd, which I *DID* buy (Best Buy has it on sale for $7.99 and you should get yourself a copy: seriously).

1. Bury Me Alive.

Weâ€™ve all heard it and seen the video. Itâ€™s amazing. Itâ€™s been out for quite a while, stirring the buzz and doing an incredible job about it. I think, though, that in this song and a few others, Carly hits some stronger notes that I donâ€™t think Amy would touch. I donâ€™t recall Amy being a yeller. I think itâ€™s in those notes that sheâ€™s pushing out with all her might is what separates the two singers and helps Carly to fall short (as far as Iâ€™m concerned). Itâ€™s a solid track though, jumpy in some parts, soft and smooth in others. Me likey.

8.5 out of 10

2. Burn

Really strong riff that starts it off, signature Ben Moody. I think I like the music of this song more than the vocals. Nothing wrong with Carlyâ€™s singing, I just think I like the mechanical and crunchy riffs. The orchestrations are a night touch, but Iâ€™m sure Iâ€™ve heard that before somewhere.. hmmmâ€¦ I wonder. Good song, not spectacular.

7 out of 10

3. Paradigm

More signature Ben Moody rock riffs. I like the softer tone in Carlyâ€™s voice here and the harmonizing on the vocals here and there. Sounds a LOT like Evanescenceâ€™s stuff off of their second CD â€œThe Open Doorâ€ more than â€œFallenâ€. Itâ€™s a great song. I like this one more than the last one. All good stuff around.

9 out of 10

4. Donâ€™t Leave Me Behind

When I first heard this song, I flipped out. Itâ€™s fucking beautiful. I canâ€™t be 100% positive but I think this is my favourite track on the disc. Like I said, I love music making me feel melancholy. The vocals on this song is fantastic, I can even get into Carlyâ€™s power showing through here and there because itâ€™s not overwhelming. I love, love, love this song. I canâ€™t say that enough.

10 out of 10

5. Sleep Well, My Angel

Hereâ€™s another one. Simply beautiful. I was really glad to have a piano-only song on this album and my wish is apparently their command. The songwriting it amazing, vocals pure and simple. Not overly sappy. I canâ€™t gush enough about how great this song is.

10 out of 10

6. Through Hell

Hereâ€™s another solid track. I love the drumming on this song. Great crunchy guitars. Great vocals. Just great.

9 out of 10

7. I Will Stay

Decent intro. Kinda sounds like 80â€™s rock a bit to me. Itâ€™s still a good song. Nothing to complain about here at all. The more I hear it though, it reminds me of a song from back in the day, I just canâ€™t put my finger on it. Iâ€™ll have to think about that oneâ€¦ It also kinda reminds me of â€œThe Storyâ€ by Brandi Carlile a bit too.. Nothing wrong with that though.. ğŸ™‚

8 out of 10

8. Without You

Color me crazy but the piano during the verses sounds JUST like â€œLithiumâ€ by Evanescence (if not a touch faster). Itâ€™s a good song. Not great. It doesnâ€™t pop to my like most of the others here, but itâ€™s not bad enough to skip past every time you hear it. I like it, I just donâ€™t love it.

6 out of 10

9. St. John

Nice haunting piano echoes in the beginning. Nice crunchy riffs again. Iâ€™m going underâ€¦. drowning in you. Sorry. Where was I? We Are the Fallen. Oh yeah. The songâ€™s good. Catchy. The choruses remind me a bit of Korn. I like this song a lot.

8 out of 10

10. I Am The Only One

Ok, the intro is dead ripped from Green Dayâ€™s â€œ21 Gunsâ€. Then when the piano kicks in, do the â€œBoulevard of Broken Dreamsâ€ ah-ah, ah-ah, ah-ah, ah-ah. Itâ€™s a BEAUTIFUL song, just feels like itâ€™s been done before. Like by Green Day. ğŸ™‚

Kick ass tune, though â€“ I canâ€™t deny that.

9 out of 10

11. Tear the World Down

Title track to the cd. I think out of all of them, this is the only one Iâ€™ve heard before but donâ€™t remember listening to. Hereâ€™s another good song. Not great. I like it, but donâ€™t love it. Itâ€™s almost there, but is missing something special to make it, well, uhhâ€¦ special? Good song, canâ€™t deny that.

5 out of 10

All in all, this CD rocks the kasbah.. Itâ€™s definetly an album to get for your collection, if you like Evanescence or not. Itâ€™s really, really good. Borderline great. If some of the tracks were a little more improved, if they had whatever was missing on making it great, this would be in my top 10. Either way, go get it.

Apparently Carly Smithson is fed up with the comparisons of We Are the Fallen with Evanescence. And I for one agree with her. Check out this article from Blabbermouth and listen to the second audio link to see how frustrated she is with the whole thing.

Sure there are coincidences. Like the fact the band was going to originally be named Fallen just like the name of the original Evanescence album. Ben Moody played in both and was one of the primary songwriters, but come on guitarist and songwriters move on to DIFFERENT things all the time right?

Amy Lee is from Arkansas and Carly Smithson is from Ireland. Carly has a huge tattoo on her right arm , Amy Lee doesnâ€™t.

The banner pic has 5 members. This one only has 4.

Carly Smithson was on American Idol and Amy Lee wasnâ€™t. See? These two couldnâ€™t be more different right?

Fuck no, Carly, shut the fuck up.In that interview where youâ€™re getting your four leaf clover in a knot you state you donâ€™t listen to Evanescence then what the hell is this that you did on the American Idol Live tour?

And then today on Blabbermouth You state that itâ€™s disrespectful to the fans to compare and itâ€™s just the media spinning drama. Really?!?! So itâ€™s ok to insult the intelligence of the music listening public but disrespectful to compare the two?

Alright lets get real for moment. Carly, you take shortcuts. You auditioned for American Idol knowing you had the skills to get fairly far. Sure beats actually selling yourself to record labels and clubs,right? Never mind American Idol is the largest karaoke competition on earth. You donâ€™t get to sing your own material but hey youâ€™re assured of of some sort of deal if you make the final 10.Right? Then you sing Bring Me to Life and Ben Moody, who lets face it hasnâ€™t done anything of note since Amy Lee split figures why not try to recapture what he had and brings you onboard because you can sing his old songs pretty well.

So now youâ€™re in this new band and its different from what previous AI contestants have done which is great but youâ€™re still involved in something that isnâ€™t your style. Youâ€™re still a puppet for someone else. Maybe thatâ€™s what youâ€™re really pissed off about. Youâ€™re looking for originality where there is none and lashing out at people for calling you on it. You want to be your own person? Then take the necessary steps to do that because for as long as youâ€™re in this project you will always be compared to Evanescence. Telling the public theyâ€™re ignorant and disrespectful isnâ€™t going to win you any brownie points especially when youâ€™re a fraud to even yourself.
